title: Nadler 2016 Zweigelt Rosé (Carnuntum)
description: Reduced at first, this wine shows lemony streaks as it takes on air. The palate is slightly dilute but driven by lemony freshness and a dry finish.

title: Peregrine 2016 Rosé (Central Otago)
description: A plump, medium-bodied rosé of Pinot Noir, this pale, coppery-salmon hued wine boasts scents of wet stone and melon. There's more than a hint of bubblegum, but once past that, it's reasonably dry and stony on the finish.

title: March 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon-Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The alcohol shows strongly on the aromas, along with dried-out fruit. The dark-fruit and herb flavors are light and elegant, with gritty tannins backing them up.

title: Marco Felluga 2013 Mongris Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This wine's oak and butterscotch aromas follow through to the lean palate, along with hints of toasted nut. Although linear and focused, it doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the evident oak.

title: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The King's Thorn Waihopai Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: This wine's flavors maybe take it a step too far into baked apple and pear territory, adding superripe melon to the mix as well. It's full-bodied, silky textured and broad in the mouth, with a touch of warmth on the finish.

title: O-Neh-Da 2015 Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: This is a slightly rustic Chardonnay offering fresh pineapple and citrus cast with a dusty earthen tone. The palate is invigoratingly though, extending a long grapefruit finish. Drink now.

title: Domaine Guillaman 2016 Les Pierres Blanches White (Côtes de Gascogne)
description: Dominated by crisply herbal Colombard, this is a light and fruity wine typical of the Gascony region. With citrus, red currant and orange-zest flavors, it is bright, breezy and ready to drink immediately.

title: La Rajade 2014 Carpizi Riserva White (Collio)
description: This blend of 80% Malvasia, 10% Friulano and 10% Chardonnay boasts French oak, candied citrus and dill aromas that lift from the glass. The lean, racy palate offers yellow apple skin and toasted nut flavors, with firm acidity.

title: Laird 2013 Flat Rock Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Densely packed with black fruit and barrel toast, this wine is mouth-puckering with tannin and power. A lightly perceptible dried herb note weaves through its dark texture.

title: Las Palmeras 2014 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Dried apple skin, lemon peel and jasmine aromas make for a pleasant nose in this widely available screwcap bottling. The palate is tangy, with sour orange notes accenting its more rounded stone fruit flavor, making for a solid weeknight sipper.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine la Colombe Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: Close to the Sainte-Victoire mountain, this estate's vineyards run between 900 and 1,300 feet in elevation. That gives this attractive wine its cool feel. It is fruity while also having a tangy texture and fine acidity. The wine is well in balance and full of fruit.

title: Hogue 2015 Gewürztraminer (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant aromas of lychee, white flowers and spice lead to elegant off-dry flavors. It brings easy-drinking enjoyment but the concentration seems a bit lacking.

title: Hogue 2015 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Jasmine, herb, flower, dried Nestea Ice Tea and peach aromas are followed by medium-sweet fruit flavors that linger. It's a pleasant easy drinker, if a bit faint.

title: Murray 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This aromatic brooder brings notes of Fruit Roll-Ups, raisins, black licorice and wood spice—seemingly a bit dried out. The fruit on the palate is sweet, also seeming a bit more evolved than its age would indicate. Drink now.

title: Seaside 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Light to medium in body, this attractive wine offers hints of lime and green apple to go with grapefruit and gooseberry. Finishes short but clean and refreshing.

title: Second Growth 2015 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: The flavors are an interesting mix of apple and pear, but with notes of pepper, celery and orange. It's a bit flat tasting, but aggressive aeration helps. Though finished dry, there is an impression of slightly granular sugar peeking through.

title: Sevtap 2013 Shark Bait Petit Verdot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This wine's aromas primary are very primary, evoking Concord grape and black plum, but hints of star anise and clove take it deeper. The flavors are jammy with superripe purple fruit, lifted by brown spice and black pepper.

title: Tug Hill 2014 Cuvée Rosé Sparkling (New York)
description: Bright and cheery, this delicately sweet Marquette sparkling offers loads of fresh forward grapey flavor. It's a simple and straightforward wine but briskly composed.

title: Volver 2015 Tarima Monastrell (Alicante)
description: Toast and leather aromas support modest berry scents. This is full, loud and banging on the palate. Roasted blackened flavors of blackberry and plum carry a meaty note, while this remains dark and toasty on an aggressive finish.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2016 Elsa Bianchi Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Gritty citrus aromas are dialed down. This feels racy and fairly well balanced. Mild but fresh flavors of lime, lychee and tropical fruits finish citrusy and collected. This is nothing special, but it's true and good for Torrontés.

title: Valle dell'Acate 2016 Zagrà Grillo (Sicilia)
description: This crisp, refreshing wine opens with subtle white flower, orchard fruit and wet stone aromas. The bright, simple palate offers citrus, peach and saline hints.

title: Fleurs de Prairie 2016 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Inside this attractively embossed bottle there is a light and fruity wine. It is crisp with juicy red-currant fruitiness and plenty of tight refreshing acidity. This is a lively bone-dry wine that's ready to drink.

title: Eagle Canyon 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh, fruity and a touch sweet, this medium-bodied wine goes easy on the palate. The aromas are citrusy, while the flavors are riper and more syrupy.

title: Whitecliff Vineyard NV Awosting White (Hudson River Region)
description: This fruity forward wine boasts punchy tangerine and lemon flavors with a tart melon-rind edge. It's a touch herbaceous and dusty but finishes brisk and clean.

title: William Hill Estate 2015 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Vanilla aromas and sweet butter and baked apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine appealing and easy to enjoy. The acidity is very light, and the texture soft.

title: Wilson 2014 Heartland Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Bold, meaty and softly simple, this robustly full-bodied wine is redolent of mocha and brown sugar. Its ripely sweet blackberry fruit is cut with savory black-olive notes.

title: Château Pigoudet 2016 Pigoudet Première Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: The wine comes from a large estate east of Aix-en-Provence. With its light fruitiness and attractive acidity, the wine is ripe with red-berry fruits and finishes with a fine crisp aftertaste. The wine is refreshing and very drinkable now.

title: Clos des Amis 2016 Rosé (Ventura County)
description: This pink blend of Mourvèdre and Grenache shows rosy aromas as well as a bitter orange scent and yeasty qualities. The palate is light in both flavor and texture but makes for a refreshing hot day sipper.

title: Collavini 2015 Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: This straightforward white has a shy nose, while the lean, simple palate suggests green apple and lemon. Firm acidity gives it a crisp, refreshing finish.

title: Damiani 2015 Bollicini Sparkling (Finger Lakes)
description: Blossomy in perfume, this Prosecco-inspired Finger Lakes sparkling offers fresh fruity citrus and red-apple flavors. It's softer and looser in petillance than wines made with Damiani's traditional method of bottling but striking acidity lends bold upright structure. Drink now.
